utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Richard! You’re dressed!

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it is morning, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, it’s just that ever since you were banned from working cases with Katherine you and your pajamas have seen an awful lot of each other.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think you’re exaggerating. I admit, I’ve taken the occasional day off to recharge, but I hardly think it’s fair –

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, Castle. You’re dressed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes! I’m dressed. I did not think it would be such an event.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Morning, babe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does this mean you have something special planned for today?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, I do have something special lined up. A surprise, actually. For you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? What kind of a surprise?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, now, if I told you that it wouldn’t be a surprise. But trust me, you’re going to love it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, now why does that scare me?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Because you’re smart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm. Come on, Castle. Spill.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A master interrogator like yourself and that’s the best you’ve got?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe I’m just getting started.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Victim is Shana Baker. According to her paystubs she worked at Eastborne Preschool. Point of entry is a window in her bedroom. Somebody broke the glass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She would have heard that. And based on her body position it doesn’t look like she was trying to run away.

utterance.speaker: SIDNEY PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: No, she wasn’t. No signs of defensive wounds or struggle. Just a single gunshot to the chest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means our killer was in here when she came home.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: How a woman so astute could choose to marry Castle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Perlmutter. Admit it. You miss him, too.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Please. Just knowing he’s not going to be here makes coming to work sheer bliss.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: All things considered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Time of death?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Ah, lividity and liver temp suggest between nine and ten-thirty last night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The neighbors were out, which is probably why no one heard the shot, but CSU … they did find this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A cigarette butt.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. It was on the fire escape outside the bedroom window and the neighbors above and below are not smokers.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Neither was the victim. Not with pearly whites like these.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if our killer had time to grab a smoke then this wasn’t a B and E. Our killer was lying in wait, which means this was premeditated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s the dog?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dog’s gone. Might have been scared off by the gunshot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or, like Lassie, Sparkles is out there trying to track down our killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? Lassie?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Someone has to provide us with out of the box thinking now that Castle’s not around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. But I’ll take it from here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? What are you doing? You know that you’re not allowed to be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I am. Because I’m no longer Richard Castle, ordinary citizen. I am now Richard Castle, Private Investigator.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got your PI’s license? Without telling me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I took an online course. Finished last night. Are you surprised?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we talk? For a second?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, a PI’s license doesn’t change anything. The DA’s still not going to let you investigate with us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you see, that’s the brilliant part. I’m not going to be investigating with you. No. Instead, I’m going to conduct my own parallel investigation alongside yours.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nice try, but you know that’s not going to fly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, it will fly. You see, as a licensed PI – – I’m legally entitled to investigate this case on behalf of my client.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah. So who’s your client?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that’s confidential.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but so is this investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s fine. I’ve already seen everything I need to here, anyway. I’ll conduct my investigation elsewhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Elsewhere, where?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that’s confidential, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is he serious?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think he is. And I think I’m getting a headache. Um … Ryan, see if you can get ahold of this building superintendent. Look for any security cams. And try to reach out to her next of kin. Espo, you and I should go to the school she worked for, see if they can tell us anything else about Shana’s life.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You really didn’t know anything about this PI thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I mean, I saw him spending hours on the computer, but I just figured he was playing TerraQuest.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, what are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, there’s not much that I can do. Look, I know that he’s doing this to spend time with me and I don’t want to hurt his feelings. I don’t know. Maybe it’ll be harmless.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Harmless? This is Castle we’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, but he knows nothing about the case. Or the victim. So how much trouble can he be?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re about to find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. How did you get here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it turns out the subway really is faster in morning traffic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I mean, how did you get here? To the school? Where Shana worked?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! Well, the neighbors didn’t know very much. I figured her work would be your next stop. So, I’ve heard about this place. It’s the feeder school in the city. They only place to be if you’re three years old and connected. Isn’t that Spaulding Elliot over there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The state’s top prosecutor. He’s on the short list for Attorney General.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And behind him, James Kahlman, internet billionaire. Even spotted Diddy in the carpool lane. No, this place is a bastion of the city’s elite. Wonder what our victim did here. What foul schemes she was tangled in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, uh … Castle. You can’t just follow me inside and sit in on my interview.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well actually, um … I was here first, so really you’re following me.

utterance.speaker: ANGELA MATTHEWS
utterance.content: Shana was our admissions director. Parents, kids … everybody loved her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did she seem to you recently? Any changes in her behavior?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If acceptance letters went out, does that mean rejection letters went out as well?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, maybe this year it did. There’s something you guys have to hear.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN WHITMAN
utterance.content: You think you can ruin my kid’s life, b*tch? I know where you live, and you’ll never see me coming.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This was left on Shana’s voicemail a few days ago and pretty much describes what happened to her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Matthews, do you recognize this voice?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, check with the rest of the staff, see if anyone else does.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll also need copies of the school’s phone records as well as a list of parents that received rejection letters.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could I get a copy of that list, too? I’m going to take that as a no. Can’t say that I’m shocked. A group of powerful people not used to hearing the word no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, Castle. You think that rejection from preschool qualifies as a motive for murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With a feeder school like this one? A rejection from here could mean not getting into the “right” elementary school, which affects high school, which affects college and oh my god. No, people do insane things for their kids. You’ll see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where are you off to?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Back to the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look Castle, if it was my choice –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, please. Why would I want to go the precinct? No, a PI’s work is done in the field and I’ve got lots of leads to follow up on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll see you tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See you tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So unfair!

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: A private investigator?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I swear, sir, I had nothing to do with this.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yet he showed up at your crime scene. Let me remind you, the DA was very explicit. Ever since he worked that case with the mob Mr. Castle can no longer take part in our investigations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s not. I mean, technically he’s conducting his own investigation and since he’s licensed legally there’s not much I can do to stop him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, Detective. But let me be perfectly clear. You cannot help him either. And that goes for you, too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No sharing of information, no granting access, nothing. Or there will be hell to pay. Understood?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How much trouble can he be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trust me, once he finds out that he has to work this case without me he’s going to get bored and he’s going to move on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He found our victim’s school without you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but that was easy. He doesn’t have access to financials, to phone records, to street cam footage. I mean, how far is he going to get?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know what would really suck? If Castle solved this case before we did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that is not possible.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but what if he did?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then we’d never hear the end of it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, no. You’d never hear the end of it. You’re the one who has to go home to that guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, there is no way that he can solve this case before us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, who are you and what are you doing with a dead woman’s dog?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: You get the drop on me? You don’t know who you’re messing with.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: Who are you? Why are you following me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t … answer … can’t … talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. My name’s Richard Castle and I’m – oh, I can show you.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pepper spray? Why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: I thought you were reaching for a gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I was reaching for my PI license.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: You’re a PI?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: Oh man, I’m sorry. Come here. I was mugged last week. You can’t trail people like that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry. I’m looking into the murder of Shana Baker.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: Whoa. Hey. Shana’s dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: She was my friend. Hey. Who killed her?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Brian Whitman. Senior partner at Tensor Capital. We traced the threatening call to his office.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guy’s a big shot with even bigger anger management problems, including slamming his Tesla into this drive who cut him off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyone at the school recognize him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but I had unis show his picture around Shana’s building. The same day he left that voicemail neighbors saw him banging on her door yelling obscenities. He promised he’d be back.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN WHITMAN
utterance.content: So I was a little aggressive when Ms. Baker didn’t let my son into that school. But that doesn’t mean I killed her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “B*tch, I know where you live and you will never see me coming.” That sounds like a death threat to me.

utterance.speaker: WHITMAN
utterance.content: I was being dramatic.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How were you being when you shot her?

utterance.speaker: WHITMAN
utterance.content: Look, you don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And neither will a jury.

utterance.speaker: WHITMAN
utterance.content: I had no reason to kill her. She changed her mind about my son. She decided to let him in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Whitman, we have the school record.

utterance.speaker: WHITMAN
utterance.content: This just happened two days ago. Called down there. You can check. I even have the letter she wrote me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Your son had already been rejected. So why would Shana change her mind?

utterance.speaker: WHITMAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. She just did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whitman’s alibi checks out. He was on an investment call to Hong Kong at the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And the school verifies his claim. Shana did reverse her decision on his son.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think she gave into Whitman’s threats?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. The headmistress said that Shana would never cut a deal. If she felt threatened she would have notified the school or the police. Unless there’s more to the story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s dig into Whitman, see if there’s anything else that connects him to Shana. He’s hiding something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, it looks like our victim might have been hiding something herself. According to this bank statement, she withdrew $3,000 in cash from her account the day before she died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I take it that’s not her normal pattern of withdrawal?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. In fact, it nearly cleaned out her savings account.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what would Shana Baker be doing that she needed that much cash?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: Shana was going out of town. That’s why she wanted me to keep Sparkles.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m assuming you’re better with dogs than you are with people. Where’d she go?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: No idea. In fact, the whole thing was sort of weird.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: Usually when I take Sparkles she tells me weeks in advance, but this was really sudden. I had to take him right away. She always tells me where she’s going, but she didn’t tell me this time. You think the trip had something to do with why she was killed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, seeing as how she dropped her dog off with you and the very next day she was murdered, my guess would be yeah, the two are related.

utterance.speaker: JEREMY
utterance.content: Where do you think she went?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perlmutter.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: What are you – you’re looking at my victim’s chart!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just making sure you filled it out properly. And may I say, for a man, you have exquisite handwriting.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Oh, give it back!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey. Look, look, look. You could make this a lot easier on me, Perlmutter.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Oh, because that’s what I live for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just believe that your victim travelled somewhere before she died. Is there anything in the autopsy that indicates where?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I would rather switch places with her than tell you. Now, give me that!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey –

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I am warning you, Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here is it. “Stomach contents: two ounces of peanuts, partially digested pretzels, blood contains trace amounts of over the counter sedative.” She was on a plane. She flew somewhere. Thanks for your help.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: This isn’t over!

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Beckett. We’re trying to explain some anomalies in our victim’s financial records. Are there any signs that she travelled recently?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Well, as a matter of fact, I was just discussing that with the writer you married!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle was at the morgue? How the hell did he find out that our victim had left town?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but Perlmutter was right about the air travel. According to TSA records, Shana took a 4:30 flight to Boston two days ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What was she doing in Boston?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She doesn’t have any family or friends there and I spoke to the school. She wasn’t there for work. But she paid for the trip in cash, like she was trying to keep It secret.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It says here that her return flight from Boston landed yesterday at 6PM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just hours before her murder that night. Meaning this mystery trip might have had something to do with her death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and look at this. According to her cell records, right after she landed she made a call to the New York Ledger’s news desk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s a preschool admissions officer doing calling the Ledger’s news desk?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe she uncovered something that she thought was a story. But I checked over there and nobody remembers talking to her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve gotta figure out what she was doing during that trip.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we do. Before your husband does and makes us all look bad.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can help with that. The last charge that Shana made on her credit card was for lunch at a restaurant two days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s right before she left town.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She split the bill with this woman. Nicole Morris. She’s an attorney at Harrison and Reed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s one of the top law firms in the country. Why would Shana be meeting with an attorney?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. But a high-powered attorney, a secret trip paid for in cash, and a phone call to a news desk. This is starting to smell like conspiracy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I hate to admit it, but baby-Castle over here might be right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Conspiracy or not, if this lawyer met with Shana just before her trip she may know something about it. So where can I find her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Her assistant says that she’s out all day with some clients, but you might be able to catch her at her 3 o’clock. Here’s the address.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nicole Morris? Uh, Detective Beckett, NYPD. I –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I work here. Welcome to Richard Castle Investigations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When were you going to tell me that you had an office?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … eventually.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. We’re married. Married people tell each other things.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but you weren’t exactly thrilled when I got my PI license.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you didn’t tell me! Now, what is she doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! She had lunch with the victim right before the victim left town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no. I mean, how did you find her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. I was checking the victim’s credit card for plane ticked charges – to see where she flew – and instead I found a lunch charge –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you checked her credit card records? How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, we’re getting into kind of a gray area here, so let’s just say it involved her mother’s maiden name and a serviceable falsetto.

utterance.speaker: NICOLE
utterance.content: Uh, I’m sorry. I have another appointment. Is this going to take much longer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Be right there, Ms. Morris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Detective, so long as you’re here, would you care to sit in on my interview?

utterance.speaker: NICOLE
utterance.content: I – I had no idea she had been killed until you called. It was quite a shock.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ms. Morris, how well did you know Shana?

utterance.speaker: NICOLE
utterance.content: Not very. I met her a few months back when I toured Eastborne School for my daughter. We hit it off but I decided not to apply this year, so I was surprised when she called the other day. She said it was urgent. That she needed to meet before she left town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she say where she was going?

utterance.speaker: NICOLE
utterance.content: Boston, I think. Something about Radnor University?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she mention why she was going there?

utterance.speaker: NICOLE
utterance.content: No. And frankly, after the questions she was asking I didn’t really want to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why? What did she ask about?

utterance.speaker: NICOLE
utterance.content: Murder. Specifically felony statutes covering murder in the commonwealth of Massachusetts. What qualifies as accessory to murder, conspiracy to commit murder, what’s the difference between murder and manslaughter, that sort of thing. utterance.content: Mr. Elliott –

utterance.speaker: ELLIOTT
utterance.content: Shana said somebody contacted her and told her I pushed Jeff. They urged her to look into the truth. And then – then she ends up dead? And you find this at the scene?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You’re claiming someone is framing you?

utterance.speaker: ELLIOTT
utterance.content: I am a criminal prosecutor. Do you honestly think that I would be stupid enough to leave a piece of evidence like this behind? Look, I made my name fighting corporate greed. And my political ambitions are no secret to anyone. This – don’t you see? This – this is the perfect way for my enemies to destroy me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay. There’s only one problem with that theory, Mr. Elliott. In order to frame you, a person would have to know that you were there at that party fifteen years ago and know that Shana Baker had just come from seeing you an hour earlier.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe there’s a simpler explanation. There is no conspiracy against you. You killed her.

utterance.speaker: ELLIOTT
utterance.content: You know, I couldn’t have killed her. Because I was at a fundraiser that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we checked into that. You got there at eleven o’clock. Shana was dead by ten-thirty.

utterance.speaker: ELLIOTT
utterance.content: I swear to you, I am being set up.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’m afraid I have no other choice but to arrest you for the murder of –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s telling the truth. Spaulding Elliott is not our killer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Was I not clear when I told you to stay away from this case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, I can see you’re upset. But I promise, in a moment you’ll understand. Jeremy? This is Jeremy. He’s the victim’s friend and dog-sitter.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, so Jeremy is some sort of a witness?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not … quite. Jeremy, if I may?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, the dog? The dog is the witness? Mr. Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just … watch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Proving this man’s innocence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mr. Elliott, if I may.

utterance.speaker: ELLIOTT
utterance.content: Please – no!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I remember reading in a profile of Mr. Elliott that he has a severe allergy to long-haired dogs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the victim’s apartment was covered in dog hair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. And does this seem like the kind of man who could wait in Shana’s apartment, let alone smoke a cigarette while he did so?

utterance.speaker: ELLIOTT
utterance.content: Please!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but, I mean, he could be faking the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: ELLIOTT
utterance.content: Please! Get him out of here before the hives start!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. I think that ship has sailed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, yeah. Definitely not faking that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So here is Spaulding Elliott arriving at the fundraiser the night of Shana’s death. Note the lack of red splotches on his face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no way that he came straight from her apartment looking like that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which means Ryan nailed it before. This is a conspiracy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ryan! You played the C card?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I mean, you weren’t around. Somebody had to step up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, for this setup to work someone had to activate Shana and tell her about the cover up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. That way her death would create an investigative path that led straight to Elliott.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Setting him up for her murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My guess is we’re dealing with some kind of big-money fixer. A shadowy, gun for hire, Michael Clayton type.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, whoever planted Elliott’s DNA at the crime scene had to have gotten the cigarette butt from somewhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means they had to intersect with Elliott at some point. If we can figure out where and when –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? But I – I brought – on a silver platter -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll show myself out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We were all after the same thing - justice. Trouble is, when it came to me, lady justice had different plans. While Beckett and the boys closed in on the killer, I’d been kicked to the gutter like yesterday’s trash. It just didn’t seem fair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. It’s not fair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Beckett. I was just listening to some notes that I made for the case – what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, we took another look at the cigarette butt. You know, the one with Elliott’s DNA. It turns out it had traces of barbeque sauce on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you said you couldn’t share.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t. But if you hadn’t shared then we’d still be looking at Elliott as our killer. And besides, we’ve got the place to ourselves, so who’s going to know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I assume Elliott has had barbeque recently?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just last week. At a rib joint uptown. We scrubbed the security footage - and you’ll never guess who we found digging through the ashcan for one of Elliott’s cigarette butts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No way! That’s our Michael Clayton?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Likely hired by whoever is behind all of this to befriend Shana, whisper in her ear, and urge her to investigate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who ensured we follow the trail to Radnor. Ooh. I wish I could see the look on their face when you slapped the cuffs on them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, maybe you can.

utterance.speaker: NICOLE
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. I got an urgent call to meet you here regarding Shana Baker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, just one final question, Ms. Morris. Who hired you to kill Shana Baker and frame Spaulding Elliott?

utterance.speaker: NICOLE
utterance.content: What – what are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think you know. That’s you, retrieving Elliott’s cigarette butt so you could plant it at the crime scene after you killed Shana.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nicole Morris, you’re under arrest for the murder of Shana Baker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I always heard Harrison and Reed were a killer law firm. And now I know why.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Case closed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think we’ll ever know who Nicole Morris works for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, she’s not going to tell us. But we did find several large payments wired to her account and Elliott is determined to find their source.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I would be determined, too. That guy would be spending time in jail if it wasn’t for a dog named Sparkles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And a PI named Castle. I’m proud of you. I just – I thought that this was another one of your larks, a way to kill time, but … you impressed me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I kind of impressed myself. I got all sorts of ideas for my new book. Just one thing didn’t work out as planned.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know that if this was up to me we would be working together, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. But since it’s not and we can’t, I was wondering how you’d feel if I … kept with this for a while?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. What’s this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s my answer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m so going to wear this to work tomorrow!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Keep going! There’s something else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So maybe you can use that to locate an actual client.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I see something I like better already. You care to go into the other room and … share?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: On one condition.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The hat stays on.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
